Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus subtilis, Staphylococcus aureus.Gram-positive bacterium:Escherichia coli.Yeast:Candida albicans.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The brazzein fold, which contains one alpha-helix and three strands of antiparallel beta-sheet.
Sequence Information.Function: Taste-modifying protein; sweet-tasting. It is 2000 sweeter than sucrose on a molar basis. Has a pH-specific antimicrobial activity against bacteria and fungi.

Literature.Title: Multidimensional signatures in antimicrobial peptides.
Literature.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2004 May 11;101(19)7363-7368.
Literature.Author: Yount NY, Yeaman MR.

Literature.Title: Solution structure of the thermostable sweet-tasting protein brazzein.
Literature.Author: Caldwell JE, Abildgaard F, Dzakula Z, Ming D, Hellekant G, Markley JL.
